headline: February is excellent for Tanzania with calving season
summary: February is one of the best months for Tanzania safari, particularly for calving in the southern Serengeti. The wildebeest calving spectacle peaks mid-February with thousands of births daily and exceptional predator action. This is technically green season with occasional rain, but conditions are generally good and prices are lower than dry season.

assumptions.text: Wildebeest calving peaks in February in southern Serengeti/Ndutu.
Predator concentration around calving herds is exceptional.
February is considered shoulder/green season with lower prices than dry season.

losses: Some areas may have restricted access

change_conditions: If calving is the goal, southern Serengeti/Ndutu is the only location.
If weather reliability is essential, dry season months are more predictable.
If combining with Zanzibar, February has good beach weather.
If migration crossings are priority, July-October is better timing.
